senselogic.sitevision.api.security

Interface MessageDigester


  • public interface MessageDigester
    Message digester that performs hash computation using a specific algorithm.

    Message digests are secure one-way hash functions that take arbitrary-sized data and output a fixed-length hash value. Implementations of this interface is typically backed by a java.security.MessageDigest instance for given algorithm.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface for a specific algorithm can be obtained via MessageDigesterFactory.

    Since:
    Sitevision 5.0.1
    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren
    See Also:
    MessageDigesterFactory

      Updates the digest with a byte.
      void updateBytes(byte[] aBytes)

        Updates the digest with a byte.

      • updateBytes

        void updateBytes(byte[] aBytes)
        Updates the digest with an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        aBytes - the array of bytes.

      • digest

        byte[] digest()
        Executes the hash computation. The digest is reset after this call is made.
        Returns:
        the array of bytes for the resulting hash value.

      • getAlgorithm

        String getAlgorithm()
        Returns a string that identifies the algorithm.
        Returns:
        the hash algorithm

Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
